title: Te Kōhanga Reo
text: Te kōhanga reo is a full immersion te reo Māori whānau programme. This means more than 80% of the communication is in te reo Māori.

links.text: Find a Kōhanga Reo near you

attributes.text: Kōhanga Reo cater for tamariki between birth and age six.
Kōhanga Reo are usually one of the lowest-cost options, but they do usually expect a contribution from parents. The exact cost varies from centre to centre.
Kaiako often hold qualifications in Te Reo Māori, but as a parent-led service there are no minimum qualification requirements.

Whānau are key and must have a vested interest in the promotion and survival of the Māori language and its cultural practices. Kōhanga Reo is not only a journey for the child but for the whole family. Kōhanga Reo offers courses for parents, through whānau learning as well as professional development for Kaiako(teachers), kaimahi and parents.
In a Kōhanga Reo, Te Reo Māori is spoken at least 80% of the time.
